csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Geometric Moving Average (GMA)
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// A moving average calculated using the geometric mean (n-th root of the product of n numbers).
11 /// Used for averaging ratios or percentages.
12 /// <list type="bullet">
13 /// <item><description>Formula: (P1 * P2 * ... * Pn)^(1/n)</description></item>
14 /// </list>
15 /// </remarks>
16 public class GeometricMovingAverage
17 {
18 public int Period { get; }
19 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
20​
21 public GeometricMovingAverage(int period = 10)
22 {
23 Period = period;
24 }
25​
26 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
27 {
28 Values.Clear();
29 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
30 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
31​
32 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
33 {
34 if (i < Period - 1)
35 {
36 Values.Add(null);
37 continue;
38 }
39​
40 // Step 1: Product of Prices
41 double product = 1.0;
42 bool valid = true;
43​
44 for (int j = i - Period + 1; j <= i; j++)
45 {
46 if (candleList[j].Close <= 0)
47 {
48 valid = false;
49 break;
50 }
51 product *= (double)candleList[j].Close;
52 }
53​
54 // Step 2: N-th Root
55 if (!valid)
56 {
57 Values.Add(null);
58 }
59 else
60 {
61 double gma = Math.Pow(product, 1.0 / Period);
62 Values.Add((decimal)gma);
63 }
64 }
65 }
66​
67 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 10)
68 {
69 var gma = new GeometricMovingAverage(period);
70 gma.Calculate(candles);
71 return gma.Values;
72 }
73 }
74}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// Logic Breakdown (GeometricMovingAverage)
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6// Geometric Moving Average (GMA) technical indicator.
7// We explain *why* code is written this way and *how* data transforms
8// line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
9//
10// [Core Concepts]
11//
12// 1. Geometric vs. Arithmetic Mean
13// [Why] The Arithmetic Mean (SMA) works by adding numbers. It works well for
14// additive data (like "how many apples do we have?").
15// However, stock prices often behave multiplicatively (compounding returns).
16// [What] The Geometric Mean works by *multiplying* numbers and taking the N-th root.
17// It dampens the effect of extreme outliers compared to the SMA.
18//
19// 2. The Formula
20// [Math] GMA = (P1 * P2 * ... * Pn)^(1/n)
21// Where 'n' is the period.
22//
23// [Visual Plan]
24// Period = 3
25// Input Prices: [2, 8, 4]
26//
27// 1. Product Calculation:
28// 2 * 8 * 4 = 64
29//
30// 2. N-th Root Caclulation:
31// 64 ^ (1/3) (Cube root of 64)
32// = 4
33//
34// (Comparison: SMA would be (2+8+4)/3 = 4.66. GMA is lower/conservative)
35//
36// 3. Edge Case: Zero or Negative Numbers
37// [Problem] You cannot take the root of a negative product in standard real numbers
38// in many contexts, and a single 0 turns the whole product to 0.
39// [Fix] If any price <= 0, the indicator returns null/invalid.
40//
41// =============================================================================
42​
43using System;
44using System.Collections.Generic;
45​
46namespace TechnicalIndicators
47{
48 // =============================================================================
49 // Logic Explanation: OHLCV Data Container
50 // =============================================================================
51 public readonly record struct CandleData(DateTime Timestamp, decimal Open, decimal High, decimal Low, decimal Close, long Volume);
52​
53 // =============================================================================
54 // Logic Explanation: Geometric Moving Average Class
55 // =============================================================================
56 public class GeometricMovingAverage
57 {
58 // -------------------------------------------------------------
59 // Logic Explanation: Configuration
60 // -------------------------------------------------------------
61 public int Period { get; }
62 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
63​
64 // =============================================================================
65 // Logic Explanation: Constructor
66 // =============================================================================
67 public GeometricMovingAverage(int period = 10)
68 {
69 // [Validation]
70 // We cannot calculate a moving average with 0 or negative period.
71 if (period <= 0)
72 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period), "Period must be greater than 0");
73
74 Period = period;
75 }
76​
77 // =============================================================================
78 // Logic Explanation: Main Calculation Method
79 // =============================================================================
80 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
81 {
82 // -------------------------------------------------------------
83 // Step 1: Cleanup & Validation
84 // ------------------------------------------------------------- //
85 Values.Clear();
86 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
87
88 // If we have no data, there is nothing to calculate.
89 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
90​
91 // -------------------------------------------------------------
92 // Step 2: Main Loop (Iterate through every candle)
93 // ------------------------------------------------------------- //
94 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
95 {
96 // [Check] Do we have enough history?
97 // Visual Check:
98 // i=0 (Need 10) -> No
99 // ...
100 // i=9 (Have 10: 0..9) -> Yes
101 if (i < Period - 1)
102 {
103 Values.Add(null);
104 continue;
105 }
106​
107 // -------------------------------------------------------------
108 // Step 3: Calculate Product of the Window
109 //
110 // [Visual]
111 // Window: [P1, P2, P3, ... Pn]
112 // Action: P1 * P2 * P3 * ... * Pn
113 // ------------------------------------------------------------- //
114 double product = 1.0;
115 bool valid = true;
116​
117 // Loop backwards or forwards through the window.
118 // Here we go from the start of the window (i - Period + 1) to i.
119 for (int j = i - Period + 1; j <= i; j++)
120 {
121 decimal price = candleList[j].Close;
122​
123 // [Why] Geometric mean involves roots.
124 // Roots of negative numbers (for even roots) are imaginary.
125 // Zero kills the entire product.
126 // Standard GMA is usually defined for positive numbers only.
127 if (price <= 0)
128 {
129 valid = false;
130 break;
131 }
132​
133 // Accumulate Product
134 product *= (double)price;
135 }
136​
137 // -------------------------------------------------------------
138 // Step 4: Compute N-th Root
139 // ------------------------------------------------------------- //
140 if (!valid)
141 {
142 Values.Add(null);
143 }
144 else
145 {
146 // [Math] n-th root of X is X raised to the power of (1/n).
147 // Example: Square root is X^(1/2). Cube root is X^(1/3).
148 double gma = Math.Pow(product, 1.0 / Period);
149
150 Values.Add((decimal)gma);
151 }
152
153 // [Visual Logic: Result]
154 // If product was huge, the 1/n power creates a value roughly
155 // within the range of the original numbers.
156 }
157 }
158​
159 // =============================================================================
160 // Logic Explanation: Static Convenience Wrapper
161 // =============================================================================
162 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 10)
163 {
164 var gma = new GeometricMovingAverage(period);
165 gma.Calculate(candles);
166 return gma.Values;
167 }
168 }
169}
python_simple:
1class GeometricMovingAverage:
2 """
3 Geometric Moving Average
4 N-th root of the product of N prices.
5 """
6 def __init__(self, period=10):
7 self.period = period
8 self.values = []
9​
10 def calculate(self, candles):
11 self.values.clear()
12 if len(candles) == 0: return
13​
14 for i in range(len(candles)):
15 if i < self.period - 1:
16 self.values.append(None)
17 continue
18​
19 # 1. Product
20 product = 1.0
21 valid = True
22
23 # Loop j from i-Period+1 to i
24 for j in range(i - self.period + 1, i + 1):
25 c = candles[j]['close']
26 if c <= 0:
27 valid = False
28 break
29 product *= float(c)
30
31 # 2. Root
32 if not valid:
33 self.values.append(None)
34 else:
35 gma = product ** (1.0 / self.period)
36 self.values.append(gma)
37​
38def calculate(candles, period=10):
39 gma = GeometricMovingAverage(period)
40 gma.calculate(candles)
41 return gma.values
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (Geometric Moving Average)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Geometric Moving Average (GMA). We explain *why* code is written this way
7# and *how* data transforms line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
8#
9# [Core Concepts]
10# 1. Arithmetic vs. Geometric Mean
11# - Arithmetic (SMA): Sum(Prices) / N
12# Used for additive data (e.g., Temperature, Distance).
13# - Geometric (GMA): Product(Prices) ^ (1/N)
14# Used for multiplicative data (e.g., Growth Rates, Percentages, Compounding).
15#
16# 2. Sensitivity
17# GMA is always less than or equal to SMA.
18# It is more sensitive to outliers on the downside (drops) than the upside.
19# [Why] Multiplicative nature dampens the effect of large positive numbers
20# but amplifies the effect of numbers close to zero.
21#
22# 3. Constraints
23# Requires all input values to be positive (> 0).
24# - Zero: Collapses the entire product to 0.
25# - Negative: Even roots of negative numbers are imaginary (Complex Math).
26#
27# =============================================================================
28​
29# -------------------------------------------------------------
30# Type-Level Explanation: GeometricMovingAverage (class)
31#
32# [Why] Simple procedural logic encapsulated for consistency.
33# [What] A smoothing filter based on geometric progression.
34# [How] Calculates the geometric mean of prices over a lookback period by taking the nth root of the product of the prices. Useful for analyzing proportional growth.
35# [Who] Index Analysts, Inflation measures.
36# [Where] Heap.
37# -------------------------------------------------------------
38class GeometricMovingAverage:
39​
40 # -------------------------------------------------------------
41 # Logic Explanation: Indicator Configuration (Public Properties)
42 #
43 # [Why]
44 # Standard lookback configuration.
45 # -------------------------------------------------------------
46​
47 # -------------------------------------------------------------
48 # Constructor: __init__
49 #
50 # [Input]
51 # - period: int (Window size)
52 #
53 # [Why]
54 # Initialize implementation constants.
55 # -------------------------------------------------------------
56 def __init__(self, period=10):
57
58 # -------------------------------------------------------------
59 # Logic Step 1: Validation
60 # -------------------------------------------------------------
61 if period <= 0:
62 raise ValueError(f"Period must be greater than 0. Received: {period}")
63​
64 self.period = period
65 self.values = []
66​
67​
68 # =============================================================================
69 # IPO: calculate
70 # =============================================================================
71 #
72 # [Input]
73 # - candles: list[dict] (Must contain 'close')
74 #
75 # [Process]
76 # 1. Iterate through data with a sliding window.
77 # 2. For each window, compute Product of all prices.
78 # 3. Take the N-th Root of the Product.
79 #
80 # [Output]
81 # - None (populates self.values)
82 # =============================================================================
83 def calculate(self, candles):
84
85 # -------------------------------------------------------------
86 # Logic Step 1: Reset
87 # -------------------------------------------------------------
88 self.values.clear()
89
90 if len(candles) == 0:
91 return
92​
93 # -------------------------------------------------------------
94 # Logic Step 2: Main Loop
95 #
96 # [Visual]
97 # Window: [P1, P2, P3]
98 # Alg: (P1 * P2 * P3) ^ (1/3)
99 # -------------------------------------------------------------
100 for i in range(len(candles)):
101
102 # -------------------------------------------------------------
103 # Logic Step 2.1: Insufficient Data
104 # -------------------------------------------------------------
105 if i < self.period - 1:
106 self.values.append(None)
107 continue
108​
109 # -------------------------------------------------------------
110 # Logic Step 2.2: Compute Product
111 #
112 # [Why]
113 # Accumulate the multiplicative total of the window.
114 # -------------------------------------------------------------
115 product = 1.0
116 valid_window = True
117
118 # Iterate backwards 'period' times
119 # From (i - period + 1) to (i)
120 for j in range(i - self.period + 1, i + 1):
121 price = candles[j]['close']
122
123 # -------------------------------------------------------------
124 # Logic Step 2.2a: Domain Guard
125 #
126 # [Decision]
127 # Is price valid for Geometric Mean? (> 0)
128 #
129 # [True Branch: Invalid]
130 # - Stop immediately. Result is undefined/invalid.
131 # -------------------------------------------------------------
132 if price <= 0:
133 valid_window = False
134 break
135
136 product *= price
137​
138 # -------------------------------------------------------------
139 # Logic Step 2.3: N-th Root
140 #
141 # [Formula]
142 # Root = Product ^ (1 / N)
143 # -------------------------------------------------------------
144 if not valid_window:
145 self.values.append(None)
146 else:
147 # Exponentiation
148 gma = product ** (1.0 / self.period)
149 self.values.append(gma)
150​
151​
152# =============================================================================
153# Functional Wrapper (Procedural Interface)
154# =============================================================================
155def calculate(candles, period=10):
156 """
157 Computes Geometric Moving Average.
158 """
159 # 1. Instantiation
160 instance = GeometricMovingAverage(period)
161
162 # 2. Execution
163 instance.calculate(candles)
164
165 # 3. Extraction
166 return instance.values
